intro: Thunbergia tsavoensis, commonly known as the Tsavo Glorybower, is a flowering plant native to Kenya. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from violet to white. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and slightly hairy, while its flowers are clustered in terminal inflorescences. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in savanna and woodland areas.
